website_summaries.verdict: This is a great value for the money. However, assembly will be much easier if you have a bit of background knowledge or DIY expertise.
pros: If the power goes out, it can pick up where it left off ("resume print") later on
Some filament is included, but you'll want to buy your own as well
cons: Several hours of assembly are required

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible and Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This 3d printer had poorly described instructions. I could not get the z and y axis to work because of the instructions skipping over some steps. When it finally did move, sparks flew out and the printer stopped. I did not touch it after that.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin V.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control not happening
customer_reviews.text: I've been a professional mechanical engineer for 20 years. Purchased the Ender 3 and right out of the box the Z-axis controller on the motherboard was bad. Took me 3 hours online with Creality support for them to verify that it was a bad motherboard. Then they said, well contact the seller.. bye. The lack of basic quality control with Creality is astonishing. I mean come on guys, this is a precision engineering machine and you didn't even test the motherboard before shipping it out. Very disappointed!! Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Lance R Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Best printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have a CR10-s, Ender 2 and now this wonderful printer, Ender 3. I can't say enough good things about this printer. My only recommendation is that you purchase a mirror box at Lowes or Home Depot to be on the top of the bed. Use painters tape or glue on the mirror. This printer is possibly better printer than my CR10-s. The Ender 3 is a great quality made printer and it has more print area than the Ender 2. You can put it together easily in less than an hour watching youtube videos. Don't waste money buying 1k printers, most of the items you will make will fit on this or the CR10-s.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Plan on spending more for replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Editing review: after about 10 prints the bed warped so bad that even with a piece of glass it will not level. contacted the seller, sent pics as requested but i haven't herd anything back in weeks. the printer is useless until i buy a new bed, and hopefully the new one isn't the same as the last. Plan on spending an extra $50 - $100 to replace the crappy parts its comes with. .
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Do not plug in to your PC with USB.
customer_reviews.text: After months of research on 3D printers, I decided on this one. Assembly was pretty easy after finding a video on how to assemble the machine. Instructions that came with it were not that good, just a bunch of pictures. After everything was set up I plugged it into the same power surge my pc was plugged into and that was the end of my pc. I spent roughly $1400 building my pc just to have it fried by this piece of junk. As a matter of fact DO NOT BUY THIS 3D PRINTER.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Having tons of issues with printer after having it only 6 weeks and manufacturer is saying they will not refund. I have spent more time on repairs than printing.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gibson

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS ONE AWESOME PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: Unable to level bed due to slight warp;however, can be fix with glass. Other than that it works. Be sure to check fasteners a couple were lose. Easy instructions but it does help to watch a few videos on YouTube for more assistance. They helped me. UPDATE: GLASS PLATE WORKS. PRINTS ARE AWESOME Sept. 2018 UPDATE: modded this to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hitchabout

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little printer for the price. As an owner of several other printers, I bought this one on a whim just because it was so cheap, and I'm super impressed. I'm getting better prints straight out of the box than I do with some of my printers that cost 5 times as much. The only two knocks I will give it is the instructions aren't the greatest if you're new to 3d printing, and the gcode test files on the included card were sliced improperly causing them to fail. Not a problem if you have some experience, but may be frustrating to first time users.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Warren

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer with one cheaply fixed gotcha
customer_reviews.text: This printer rocks as it is BUT if you buy this printer buy the upgraded Yellow print bed springs at the same time or you'll forever be re leveling it. Comes with a complete mini tool kit for assembly & maintenance (including wire cutters!) and some spare parts. Customer support for Comgrow is outstanding, they resolved my issue immediately. *Follow the outstanding online guide by Luke Hatfield for assembly and calibration no matter what level you're at! (yeah, I know you already know everything about 3D printers...) Built & calibrated right this printer rivals some costing twice as much, just at the very LEAST calibrate your E-Steps and flow.
customer_reviews.author: RB2Much

customer_reviews.title: Read this before you put it together. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. This is my first time printing and I am glad this is the machine I bought. Super easy to put together. However before you start going at it with the paper directions I have a secret for you. On the SD card that comes with it, in one of the files there is a video that is much much better to follow. Do NOT jump into it with the paper directions. Look at the SD card first.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, But received a Defective
customer_reviews.text: I gave a one star towards the one I received. I had to spend countless days, to fix the parts that came broken, and defective and missing. I had to invest more money to get it running properly. So, since I purchased a second hand I can not tell whether the new is same, but for my experience it is a heck wreck! So I leave you find out yourself. Will not Recommend, Will not prevent you either. After all it's a chineese made and you want to expect less to no support at all.
customer_reviews.author: kohp

customer_reviews.title: Tons of wasted filament.
customer_reviews.text: Attempt after attempt to level the bed (and I've got it level each time) I go to print and then have my prints sliding all over the place. Filament spooling everywhere and being wasted...the bed is most likely warped. The filament won't stay in one spot and refuses to adhere. I've got a glass plate bed coming in designed specifically for this unit and if that doesn't fix the issues, I will most definitely be returning it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Healsfire

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! Can't beat it for the price and the print quality is excellent 👌 as with all 3d printers it takes some tinkering to get it dialed in. Make sure to buy filament because the sample that comes with it is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer ly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer for the price - started printing after a fairly short assembly
customer_reviews.text: I've worked with multiple 3D printers and built several of my own design. For the price, the fact it's fully open source, the quality of all the parts, relatively fast to build and does very good quality prints, it's nearly unbeatable. It's a bit mind boggling you can get such great results for 3d printers in this price range. I've done 4 small to medium prints in the last few days using Linux and print over USB with several different softwares. So happy with the results and I'm not locked into some proprietary software where I have to use windows. Now, I'm free to create my own design work-flows. Very happy this, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: This 3D printer is just overpriced. It is not woking well, the instruction is so confusing and very difficult to operate. I would like to spend more money to get anther brand.
customer_reviews.author: shu Qiu

customer_reviews.title: My best choice!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th 3d printer and by far the best. Fairly simple to assemble, it uses really good parts made of metal rather than 3d printed plastic like some of the others. Also, unlike the Monoprice Mini Pro, it DOESN'T have an auto-leveling feature (that is a good thing). The user has control over the leveling with simple and effective controls. Also, the main control panel is straight forward and easy to read. From my very first print, the quality is exceptional. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Magley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like it, didn't really work well. spend more for a quality printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer honestly never worked well. It didn't stay level for more than 3 prints without new springs, and then it was only every 2 weeks. The aluminum bed warped so it sagged in the middle, which meant another 20 bucks for a glass bed. The glass bed needs glue to hold a print. The nozzle clogged and stripped when trying to remove despite following their directions (heating to 230 first). Basically I got a handful of good prints in between hours of headaches and troubleshooting. Not worth the money when a lot of printers for a little bit better will work right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad printer for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: There's a bit of a learning curve if you've never done any 3D printing before, and it was quite frustrating when I got everything set up, printed out one of the test models on the microSD card that came with it, which came out perfect, and then tried going to Thingiverse and downloading one of their models. Things didn't go so well then because I didn't know what I was doing. I figured it out, and as far as I can tell the printer works great. If there's a problem, it is most likely user error.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I have had the Ender 3 for 5 days now and loving it.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to assemble it correctly. Watch a few YouTube videos how to assemble it correctly and make sure there is enough tension on the belts. I have been printing 24/7 on the Ender 3 and for the price you cannot beat it even though on amazon it's a little more than other places. Coolest print so far beside printing random things off of thingiverse is my usb powered water pump to pump in new water in to my fish tank instead of having to hold 10 gallon buckets slowly pouring them in.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great! After some initial issues
customer_reviews.text: I received this machine quickly and successfully did the setup, with no issues on my end. After many failed prints, I realized the x-axis motor was not functioning. After a lot of troubleshooting with help from Comgrow support, they sent me out a new mainboard to replace the old one. After this, the CE3 has been printing great, with many successful prints since then. I definitely have to recommend this printer due to great support and a great printer once all the issues were ironed out.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I posted the original review below, and shortly after the seller contacted me and offered to send a replacement fan and bed. I have changed the review from 2 to 5 stars. This is an excellent printer, especially for the cost, and comes with great customer service. Original review: Not a bad printer, once you spend more money to fix the issues it has. The hotend fan started rattling after 24 hours, and essentially failed after 48. The bed is warped, with the center being lower than the edges, so it is nearly impossible to level the bed well enough for large prints.
customer_reviews.author: Bbb

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This is my first 3D printer and it took a bit to figure out how to dial in the settings to get consistently good prints, but this printer has been a joy to use. I do 3D art for a living, so being able to print out my sculpts and see them in real life is an amazing feeling. I would recommend this printer to any hobbyist or person wanting to get into 3D printing. It might not be the absolute best printer out there but it's still very good quality and for the price, you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out
customer_reviews.text: The estimation of 4hrs is very conservative, I actually took mine time and it took ~2hrs so dont a scare-ed. Couple of things couple be clearer but listen my 1st printer was a Anet A8 - Prusa i3 DIY 3D Printer - Prints ABS, thing took me a SOLID 8hrs, and it printer but the extruder was a nightmare, spool holder sucked it, bed leveling sucked it!! Put ENDER together set bed height and PRINTS AWESOME!! No issues OTHER THEN AS STATED ELSEWHERE ENSURE THE POWER FOR POWER SUPPLY GETS CHANGED FROM 230v(European) to TO 110V(USA), if not it just wont power up once switch is toggled on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nailed It
customer_reviews.text: The Ender 3 nailed it on simplicity, easy to build, easy to use, accurate and reliable. The price is really good for what this thing can do too. I've had one for a few months now and its been running nearly 24 hrs a day with no sign of weakening. It holds tolerances very well. It forms straight lines and perfect circles pretty close to perfect. The Only Downside: The only thing I don't like about this was the provided micro SD card and USB adapter. They're both crap. Get a good quality SD card (and card reader if you need one for your computer). I got a 16 GB Sandisk micro SD card and its been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Neightn

customer_reviews.title: Decent Starter Printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two Ender 3's nearly 2 years ago from Congrow. I have since purchased a ton of parts from Congrow. Service seems good. One printer has been nothing but trouble from the start. I should have returned but thought it was user error. After 2 years of hardly printing with it, I found that the X gantry is bent and the bed is warped. I cannot find a replacement X gantry anywhere. It prints, just not the same as the other. I am assuming the quality control has improved since my purchase. I am also unsure how to contact Congrow for replacement parts. I found little information on their Amazon page.
customer_reviews.author: Lazygun71

customer_reviews.title: Great first 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first-time 3D printer. Assembly was a little complicated, but you just need to look at the PDF manual that comes on the MicroSD card, not the little paper that comes with it. Much better instructions there. My AV dinged the Windows Software as having a virus, but it looks like it may be a false positive.. Not sure, I use Linux... My recommendation: Get it, build it, level the bed, level the bed again, test a pring (gcode), level the bed one more time (just in case), then print away! Looks like it also has a ton of printable additions to make it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Challenges even 800 dollar printers
customer_reviews.text: What a beast for 200~ this printer has some serious quality and speed for its medium frame size. The body is full aluminium and quite hefty, which is good for reducing shaking. pretty easy to put completely together, maybe an hour from multiple parts on your desk to bed leveling. Only thing I'd say could use improvement is the placement of the micro sd slot, its low enough to the table I had to buy an extender cable to
customer_reviews.author: Aeon

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Challenge a Given and No Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Was tough to figure out how to put it together and get it running. The instructions are a joke and little support for it on the internet. Will give another review should I produce some results. I got it together only to find out the fan in front of the Nozzle is bad. Contacted manufacture and they said contact seller which I have been unable to reach. Sent a video via email as requested and still nothing. Will probably break down and buy a replacement fan so I can use this printer. So far no warranty support so buyer beware your on your own if it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are not the clearest, but straightforward assembly.
customer_reviews.text: My first go into 3d printing and I was beyond excited. Thank to Prime shipping, I got this two days earlier than its original ETA. The assembly instructions (printed on a large piece of paper, double sided and colored) leave a bit to be desired. The test prints are cool, but there was not enough PLA included to complete a print, which caused my first print to (basically) fail, as I could not open my new spool of PLA in time to feed it without issue. That said, I still have to play around with it a bit more but I am very excited and happy with my experience so far!
customer_reviews.author: wchiang

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE OVER PRICE
customer_reviews.text: First of all this printer is way over price you can get it at the creality website for $189. second the printers bed is not working anymore after a month and the arms are defective and i have to adjust the bed level every single time. Don't get me wrong these printers are really good machines I have other printers and they work really good. So do yourself a favor and buy them at the creality website they have a lot in stock.
customer_reviews.author: J Z

customer_reviews.title: install nightmare
customer_reviews.text: got to step three and found that the majority of the screws had nothing to bite on so either the screws were too short or the threads within the hole were stripped, placed item back in box and will be returning, guess I just saved myself $229.00.
customer_reviews.author: David Konetski

customer_reviews.title: Tricky at first, but worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest. Assembly for this thing is tedious and confusing. Luckily, there are some great online videos or else you will never get it right. As with others, my z stop was too high with the built in step so it had to be modified. Had a few bumps starting out. The software for converting online print files to gcode is hidden on the included sd card. It also took me longer than I care to admit to find the sd card slot on the Ender itself. My first big print, the heating pad slipped out of place and ruined everything. Overall, it's well worth the price and very enjoyable. A great way to waste lots of time!
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great 3d printer worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great low priced 3d printer. Assembly via included picture instructions suck. They are unclear and confusing fortunately I watched an assembly video which is easily found which made assembly easier. I was missing the top screw that clamps the threaded rod to stepper motor but local hardware store had one. Other missing part was the licking nut for the filament roll holder, I simply used wire ties I am now printing a new style filament holder that was a free download.
customer_reviews.author: Gandolf

customer_reviews.title: Son loves this printer!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this printer for our13-year-old son and he is having a ball using it! He has made many items this far. It was pretty easy to put together, but it took some time. He looked on youtube for help in troubleshooting, and the solution was resolved. Thank you for an awesome product for this spectacular price.
customer_reviews.author: loyal67

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Setup took under an hour, and with very little fussing I was in business. My bed does seem to have a slight warp in the center, but it's fairly common for "cheaper printers". That's really the only thing I think was cheaped out on with this printer. The print quality is amazing, and you can print very fast compared to other models around this price. It's a great buy for what you're getting.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: great printer, hard to print at the advertised 50 mm/sec
customer_reviews.text: The product is mainly for entertainment. I have managed to get some great prints after a little change to my printing mindset. I have had no luck printing at 50 mm/sec, but the item in the image printed at 20 mm/sec. I have already gone through the check all settings and stuff, basically, the printer sings at 20 mm/sec.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mark Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Best 3D printer ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer if you're just getting into 3D printing. directions could use a little improvement however there are tons of videos on YouTube. I'd recommend purchasing a raspberry pi or a refurbished desktop to run octoprint. For $200 this thing is well worth the price. the manufacturer does need to add thermal runaway protection. You can update your firmware it's a pretty straightforward process however out of the box it does not have this enabled. I would personally like to see auto bed leveling and future models. All in all my experience has been perfect and I purchased exactly what I got an awesome 3D printer.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McClain

customer_reviews.title: The best low cost printer on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Take your time putting it together and it's fantastic. Watch a few videos, there are a few minor tweaks that will get everything square. If you do it's very easy to operate and can produce great prints. 210 degrees for the hot end, 60 for the bed, level it with receipt paper, and buy a piece of glass from your local home improvement store to replace the build surface that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey

customer_reviews.title: Good first 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's one of the best. It's short comings are well documented on Youtube. It's slow, it's loud, it's not very accurate, and it's prone to printing errors. Even with all these short comings if your just getting into 3D printing it's one of the best options. The bad things about it may actually be good, it will teach you how to solve all these problems in the future. All that being said, if you have any experience with 3D printing, I would strongly recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Niko C

customer_reviews.title: Extrusions not square or flat.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this but it was extremely disappointing from the beginning. The metal extrusions were not milled square - not even close. That’s as far as I took it. I’m not sinking $250 into a printer that has poorly milled parts. That will just lead to inconsistent prints and frustration. I read a few people shimming the extrusions; no thanks. It came with no shims and honestly you shouldn’t have to shim this. Eventually they’ll come loose or wiggle free. Overall very disappointing to see such poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron L

customer_reviews.title: HELP! I dont know what to do!
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to get a clear print once. I cant even get a FULL PRINT, ive had it for 2 weeks. not a single print turned out. its globs at the nozzle and continuously spits out filament all over the damn place leaving a stringy ass mess. ive played with settings in cura and messed with the machine (tightening and loosening) its just a waste of time as it hits a quarter of the way stops layering all together and just clumps and falls apart. what is left is crappy thin layers of crap. made for beginners my ass.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son is going to college for computer science and on a robotics team. He loves anything tech! He bought this for fun, to learn, and make parts for the robot. The only reason I gave this 4 instead of 5 is he read many reviews and some said that beds came with a slight dip in the middle. That may or may not matter to some. But it did for their parts they needed. It was an easy fix. There is a bed you can order for $20 and that fixes the problem so it was a gamble he was willing to take since he knew there was a solution. He LOVES this printer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Hart

customer_reviews.title: I knew nothing, now I know
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying the world of 3d printing with this Ender 3. I did get a bundle with a few upgrades. I also printed a few upgrades once the parts were assembled square and as true as possible. Check out the front leveler knobs! Got to give credit to someone else's basic design for the CR10, but this adaption is an ergonomic plus for leveling the hot plate! As others have said in their reviews Youtube is a library of info to get started and learn. Wish I had one sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Conzoomer

customer_reviews.title: First printer as an engineer
customer_reviews.text: I am a mechanical engineer and this is my first personal printer. I have made several printed upgrades to the printer as well as some purchased items like capricorn ptfe tubing. If you are willing to put in the time to research and improve the printer it can be great. It has fair dimensional accuracy. It is normally a few thousandths of an inch small. I also recommend using Cura as the slicer software and looking for settings that other people use. It is worth saying that I have had a low print failure rate and that has been very impressive. All in all it was a great purchase and I highly recommend it as a first printer.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great starter 3d printer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 15 year old son. I was able to assemble it in about 45 minutes, without any prior 3d printer experience. Even though the directions were all pictures, no actual written directions, assembly went smoothly. We ran a test print with the 8x8 maze using the included PLA filament. It took about an hour, and was spot on. My son has since printed several figures, and assorted keychains. No big issues have presented. **TIP** Make sure to order filament with printer, trying to buy from local stores is difficult since most places do not carry it. **TIP #2** Wipe off the glass bed, and level it prior to each use.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: My printer was easy to assemble, but I still watched a few videos before I tried it. So far the print quality has been excellent and I’ve had no issues. I’m still printing upgrades for the printer, but am looking forward to making some larger prints. I’m shocked at the quality that is possible for such a small price. EDIT: I bought my second one of those from Comgrow a month ago and the bed wouldnt get warmer than 50C. I did some diagnostics and emailed Comgrow. They quickly send me out a replacement bed and it works great now. Im keeping the 5 stars for their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Big C

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for my first printer
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot about the printer before ordering. When it go here I took my time setting it up. If you just slap it together you likely wont be very happy with your results... TAKE YOUR TIME and get the alignments set up properly... For a budget price I think you get better than budget value... I have been quite satisfied so far. Since getting it I have printed out several upgrades for it, I also added the glass bed, bltouch and upgraded the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: buzzsawddog

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck, or whatever you use to buy things I guess...
customer_reviews.text: Best first printer! Really all that needs to be said is that when you get the machine find the video on YouTube on how to assemble not just build this printer. To get the best prints you need to have the best possible assembly, squared up and solid. 10/10 - would buy again. 10/10 - would recommend to a friend. 7/10 - assembly process. (Third hand helps it’s a little daunting alone) 7/10 - software friendliness (easy for beginners) -9000/10 - leveling the bed for the first time....(user error involved...) 11/10 - happiness with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian

customer_reviews.title: Don't think about it, just buy it! Trust me I'm a professional
customer_reviews.text: You're going to need to follow a YouTube tutorial to out it together right. That being said I absolutely love this thing. I have been printing masks for family and friends and recently some fun pet projects. Print resolution is phenomenal for the price and it's a really awesome starting kit. It will require some love to keep it operational, but I doubt that's any different with even the $1000+ printers
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Print At All
customer_reviews.text: I did everything that I could to get this printer to work, I even returned it and got another one but it STILL didn’t work. I troubleshooted it, I unclogged everything, I double checked all the plugs and even changed filament and still nothing 🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Genbon

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my hubbys life!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby is now printing 24/7. Creativity is fostered and designs are limitless. He has already moded this and Tells me, "You ruined my life." He is in a sink hole of printing and now stays up till the wee hours of the am. Excellent for beginners and will have the ability to add additional parts. He added a glass slab to the print bed.
customer_reviews.author: dental nerd

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY EVEN IF YOUR LIFE DEPENDED ON IT,PITIFUL PITIFUL PITIFUL
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOT FOR BEGINNERS very hard set up, easily broke and just doesn’t work very terrible quality my kid was soooooooooooooooo exited about it and it didn’t work I DO NOT RECCOMMEND DO NOT BUY very crappy 3D printer very expensive and crappy
customer_reviews.author: adam marchand

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed and built. Good for rapid prototyping .
customer_reviews.text: The printer is fairly easy to set up, and there are plenty of YouTube videos to help you set it up and test it out. The adjustments are understandable and easy. To do prototyping you need to learn the basics of some free apps like TinkerCad and CURA. (These apps are also well described on YouTube.) Two weeks of study has already saved me months of design and testing time.
customer_reviews.author: Russel C Kiger II

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer/Wonderful Seller
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new Ender 3. It prints wonderful. It was easy to assemble. It has a few flaws one being my bed is warped but I contacted the seller and I have a replacement bed on the way. I can't wait to be able to print on the whole bed instead of just the middle. The placement of a couple of the limit switches are wrong but with some adjustments it's fine now. For the price you can't go wrong buying this printer. UPDATE: I was promised the new hotbed would be delivered in 2 weeks. Two weeks later I received it. A big thank you to Cathy in customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Warped heating bed on arrival - Contacted Cathy at Comgrow and she was able to help.
customer_reviews.text: The bed on my Ender 3 is warped , it came this way and the return window is closed. But I contacted Cathy and she sent another one. She was able to help me install the new one. Now my ender 3 is cooking day and night. Thank you Comgrow! We are returning customers almost 12 orders at this point. Thank you so much again! The Ender 3 is a great beginner printer and I learned a whole lot on it!
customer_reviews.author: William Donato

customer_reviews.title: This is the best way to get started with 3D Printing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best way to get started with 3D Printing. Great value and build volume and ease of use. A lot of flexibility and great support groups and forums and videos out there to get you going. You can't go wrong as a beginner with this printer and lots of people who are experienced with 3D printers love this printer too. But... have realistic expectations and you will enjoy the 3D printer world starting with the Ender-3.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great first time 3d printer!
customer_reviews.text: Great first time 3d printer! I had this going almost full time the first few weeks I had it. I've printed a ton of stuff with this printer. I've even printed a bunch of parts that are very useful such as tools and mounts. Works great! The only issues I've had are getting the first layer to stick. You just need to get the deck at just the right level and the first layer will stick correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Marc R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Printer! DEF BUY~
customer_reviews.text: Heated Bed! Tons of possibilities and for the price its ridiculous... Love it! So many printable parts for it as well! BUY! Setup time is about 30 minutes to an hour if your not great with tools. Setup is a little wonky but just do your research, follow the guides. Get on some Facebook groups and ask questions, everyone is so helpful being its a great priced printer many have it and have different hacks and experiences with it! Cannot go wrong with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: brandon j harris

customer_reviews.title: You need to be somewhat knowledgeable in file transfer and Autocad or Solidworks
customer_reviews.text: After just a few trials, we have been using this machine without problems for a few months. You need to be patient and learn how to communicate between your design software and the 3D printer, and then try different tool paths, and change the speed to make better products. We use a sheet of paper to align the printer head. And you should pay attention to the cleanliness of the printer head to avoid clogging. Do not leave the machine on and not attended when it is not printing!
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little machine
customer_reviews.text: I had it together in 3 hours, from unboxing to running some bed leveling gcode. While this is my first 3D printer, I've built commercial CNC routers and robotic tape storage systems, so none of this technology was new to me. Your results may vary. I bought it primarily because I wanted to learn the 3D printing workflow (idea->cad->slice->print) more than I expected magic from this machine. It certainly is a good entry level machine for that, and at the right price point. If I had kids, this would be a great 'first printer'.
customer_reviews.author: French

customer_reviews.title: Glad it was cheap
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is actually a reasonably good value. Easy to assemble with basic mechanical ability. Reasonable easy to use once you figure out the software to create your models. As for the three, the prints have stringy hairs all over and I have lost so many prints to prints coming off the base. So sloppy prints that sometimes finish. Again, 200 bucks so I am gonna live with it
customer_reviews.author: NJ_Tax_Man

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality and seems fast
customer_reviews.text: We have no experience with 3d printing but so far this thing has provided countless hours of fun. My son has created all kinds of widgets he found online and imported. Hoping he takes it to the next step and designs something of his own. I do believe he has struggled at times getting the bed leveled. We have not tried installing glass or a piece of mirror on the bed but I would imagine that to be a great upgrade. This was a Christmas gift and it's still laying thread!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: For this price this is amazing machine. The quality of printing is sufficient and you can play with settings in the software. This is a perfect solution if you want to start 3d printing and do not want to spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This 3D printer is a very good printer to start off as a beginner in the 3D printing world. This printer is also great as it has a huge community for it and people helping each other out. It also has lots of upgrades with it. The only down flaw with this printer I experienced was my printer bed was warped and made it harder for me to print. Luckily I overcame this problem with auto mesh bed leveling which too me time to get down. Pros: Cheap Lots of great upgrades Huge community base (YouTube,Facebook,etc) Cons: Warped bed Will be continuing many prints with this printer
customer_reviews.author: Amir Misleh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Build, Needs a few QoL improvements
customer_reviews.text: Initial review - The Ender-3 arrived promptly and was very well packaged. Everything was separated in their own packages and nothing was moved around in shipment. Now a little bit about the Ender-3: Pros: Very nice, lightweight compact design Large Printing bed Great Price Point Fairly Quiet Cons: The instruction manual is unclear in some steps Should come with more filament - doesn't even come with enough filament to print the test piece A better "How to get Started" manual is needed As I use the printer I'll have more feedback. Be sure to be clear on how to level the table as this seems to be the biggest concern people run into.
customer_reviews.author: Drasten

customer_reviews.title: A great into and an easy build!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll end up adding a picture of the build later, I’m going to upgrade somethings such as the tubing, print head and adding a auto leveler (BLTouch) but over all for a beginners kit these seems extremely well built and thought out. Being my first time into 3D, but also being a computer engineering student it’s very straight forward with the software installation as well as the recommended raspberry pi sever to connect to whatever slicing program you use rather then connecting directly or using the SD card for offline use. Building it was a breeze, despite what others say. All the parts and even extras bolts were included, paper instructions weren’t that clear but not vague enough to misunderstand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great for newcomes to 3d printing and even experienced users. Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starting printer for anyone to get into 3d printing. I had gotten really good prints after getting my settings setup. It's easy enough for anyone to start learning and for more experienced user they can get into adding new parts and even using a raspberry pi to get more setup changes and printer control. I have had this for 3 months now and I use it all the time. I would suggest anyone starting out uses PLA filament until you get the hang of using the printer. I have successfully gotten PETG it to print with some minor tweaks using cura. Very reasonable priced and the seller has been great
customer_reviews.author: joshua kompa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRINTER!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 3D printers now and this is by far my favorite!! I own a Folgertech i3 and have peen printing regularly with that, but I needed better accuracy and rolled the dice on the Ender-3. I am extremely happy with this printer, and wish I had 3 more of them. It did however arrive with a dead extruder motor, but I had an extra to replace. I didn't reach out to the supplier for a replacement, so I can't say how they handle replacements etc.. Again, I love the performance of this printer, and for $200, you cant beat it! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ANDS123

customer_reviews.title: Love this 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to assemble. I took my time and it took me about an hour and a half. After leveling it I printed the Test Dog GCode. It came out great for my first 3D print. I then downloaded a few item to print. One was a filament guide, shown in the image.. Very happy with this printer. Great price, great service and fast shipping. If you are considering a 3D printer, this is it! It is so popular that there are hundreds of mods and add on for it as well as videos for almost anything you can think of. It is simple to setup and understand. The software is very simple to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: DPeter2101

customer_reviews.title: Firmware has thermal runaway and Comgrow supports their sales of the Ender3!
customer_reviews.text: Comgrow supports their sales! When I received my Ender3, 2 of the 4 v rollers for the Y axis were damaged, I asked Comgrow to send me 2 replacements. They quickly sent me a spare parts kit, with 4 rollers, upgraded bed springs, PTFE tube, and an additional wire harness! Nice! I was also pleasently surprised at some of the details of this version of the Ender3. It has a silicone hot end sleeve, a nice plus. It also came with firmware with thermal runaway protection already active, critical for fire safety!
customer_reviews.author: Caboco

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Starter Printer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect 3D printer for beginners. It definitely gets you started and is perfect for small projects. Larger projects with it are definitely something that I wouldn't leave completely unattended while printing though. Sometimes it does need minor adjustments or checking in on. One thing is for sure, it is a great 3D printer to start out on that's completely affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Moore

customer_reviews.title: fun for starters
customer_reviews.text: its fun to try this out as its my first 3D printer but the quality of outputted printed objects are not the same to what i have seen on youtube. its been a month of trying to optimize it to get better quality but so far not happening. i have a hard time trying to level the bed with the nozzle and defiantly needs a new bed cover of glass. the cover given is already warped after a month of use. But the seller is very helpful and has helped me out replacing the bed with no cost so I bumped up the rating of the seller. Very great support.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable qualify for the money. This is my second 3d printer and I'm blown away with how well this prints. It does have a few little quarks, but must all of them can be fixed with a few 3d printed upgrades. I highly recommend this printer because of the quality of the prints and the low price. I bought one for myself and also a friend who is a teacher. We've both been very impressed with this thing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Better than I imagined - newbie first 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: My first 3D printer. I didn't want to invest a lot of $$$ and Creality appeared to have the best value. A lot of good reviews and I took the leap. It assembled quick and easy. Tip- use a Square to assure everything is lined up, is square, measures the same top and bottom. My uprights were not square, loosened the bolts, squared up and everything fell into place. Adjusted bed, loaded a g-code file and first prints turned out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kenaisteve

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 year old son for this long out of school stay at home period so he can build things like he loves to while being home all day long. He assembled it with my husband. So far, its working good. Seller also provided excellent communication and customer service. We will be buying an advanced closed model in the future from this same seller if they sells one on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkyLovesShopping

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: The first one had a part missing so we returned it and we were sent a new one. It has been working smoothly for close to a year now. My son uses it a lot. No complaints. I think it's very much worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: Dewdrop

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to 3D printing and thought I'd give this machine a try. I'm quite impressed with the first round of printing I did! For someone who is not very familiar, this product worked beyond my expectations. Assembly is very easy! Leveling the plate is the most difficult part. Great printer if you're just starting or on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: CASEY RITTNER

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: You’ve seen the YouTube reviews. Just buy it. This thing seriously amazes me. Pay attention to adjustments and alignments when you assemble it and it’ll blow you away. It has a few issues to fix like, the Y stop switch location, exposed cpu fan, beds can be dished (buy the glass Creality bed, you’ll love it too). It’s super affordable and well worth working through a few issues. Lots of info out there on fixing them. I’m getting ready to buy another one to speed up my production times.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a month
customer_reviews.text: Ok so let me start off by saying this is an amazing printer and don't let my 3 stars fool you after a month the extruder would not spit out filament so I sent it back and got a new one same thing happened but support was very nice I have ordered the pro version form the official creality website and its been working for 2 months now I would really really really recommend this printer as long as you know what your going to get
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Printer comes partially assembled. The rest of assembly is quick and easy. Most of the construction is steel and of good quality. The bed mat warps when heated and mine has a bubble in it that throws off my print. Broke the feeder tension arm in the first week, for being an important spring loaded part it is one of the only plastic parts. I replaced with steel after it broke.
customer_reviews.author: connor

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Assemble High Quality Printer Kit
customer_reviews.text: I found it quite fun to assemble this printer. Once assembled, it was also easy to level the bed and send data to it through the included software. This printer is amazingly accurate at the price that it's sold. It's capable of printing at .06mm height layers. The heated bed makes it much easier to produce fine results, even without the normal rafts and support structures. There's an amazing amount of community support behind the firmware which the printer runs, and advanced users should try flashing it with the latest operating software.
customer_reviews.author: BringTheBandalore

customer_reviews.title: Amazing first printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first printer and I cannot recommend it enough. Assembled the printer in about 40 mins, was printing within the hour. Have been running it for about 12 hours a day since I got it pretty consistently and everything is running extremely smooth. Tons of printable upgrades online and an unbelievable community behind this product. Obviously the first to-do was to get octopi and believe me, that is a must. You will not be disappointed. Bought for $240 9/18 and it is worth well over that price imo. JUST BUY IT ALREADY
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best value
customer_reviews.text: I have a background in rapid prototyping dating back to the late 90s, I am very impressed with the quality of the printer for the price. You can't find a better printer without paying significantly more. Additionally, there are a lot of affordable upgrades that can be done to greatly improve an already great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Maro

customer_reviews.title: Absolutly Phenomenal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Is this printer perfect? No. But for $200 it does a wonderful job Stringing can be in issue but that's mostly on me for no tuning it properly. It was easy and quick to set up, and I've been very satisfied with it. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy starting out.
customer_reviews.text: For my first printer, I think it’s pretty good. Assembly was pretty straight forward with some help from the internet. The instructions themselves were lacking, but there’s enough people using it to not need to reinvent the wheel. Bed leveling took a bit to get through, but once that was done the sample dog went pretty well. I tried pausing to insert a roll of filament, but that was a bit more finicky than I expected. Had to stop that one, and moved right into one I was wanting to do. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: HappierThanABird

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This was my first printer. I did try another brand and had horrible results, just thought it was the learning curve but I was making no headway so I returned that printer and got this one. Right out of the box the set up was fairly simple and the very first print came out very well. A little tweeking to some settings and bed leveling and it was printing with very high quality. Its been a real work horse I've had it printing face shield frames for the last week, 24 hours. Each frame takes 4 hours to print. Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.author: Ed Zeledon

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D printer wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow ! Where to start this printer is amazing the quality of the print is just as good as my Ender 3. The construction of the printer is very solid and sturdy, it was very easy to set up and I used the Cura software to print from. One thing I love about it, is that it has a bed leveling program which is a HUGE help when printing. (The models I printed came out very smooth but I was going to paint them so I sanded it that's why it looks sanded)
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Godwin

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a work horse
customer_reviews.text: This printer is quite amazing for its price point. Are there things you can improve on it? Yes, but for the price you can't beat it. The printer showed up within a few days of ordering and I didn't have any major issues with it that aren't already documented like needing to update the firmware on the printer. The power plugs seem to be solid on my printer, but I recommend checking yours.
customer_reviews.author: Costoda

customer_reviews.title: 100% buy this
customer_reviews.text: Extremely simple to build for anyone even mildly technologically inclined. All I had to do was mount the screen, the vertical rails, and the cross beams as well as mount the tracks and the hotend. leveling the bed is very easy with the massive knobs and once all of your wheels are tightening down, it prints incredibly cleanly. You can change the temperatures and speeds on the fly so if you see some problems early on, you dont have to restart! only thing I would like to see in the future is an autoleveling bed but that's nitpicking at this price
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pesky

customer_reviews.title: Just a Heads Up!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this so other people don't make the mistake we did. This 3D printer is only compatible with the Windows Operating System. We have a MacBook Pro so we could not get the software to work unless we downloaded this third-party software. We were not comfortable with that. I am writing this review only because the return was absolutely hastle-free. Kudos to this company :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my son as a Christmas gift and I must say, its the best 3d printer ever, assembled in an hour, and it prints right out of the box, just make sure you follow ever step to detail,
customer_reviews.author: J. Pickus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Tech Support!
customer_reviews.text: We cannot get the printer to work after building it and neither Amazon nor Creality are able to offer support. They say we need to contact Comgrow and they have not responded in over two weeks. We would love to be able to let you know how the print quality is but we have no idea. Extremely disappointed. Worst customer service we’ve had from both Amazon and the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: MrsW

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat the price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 2 hours to assemble because I took my time and double checked everything was square and tight where it needed to be and loose where it needed to be. The cheep compression fittings failed within days, got replacements and spares from overnighted for $10. Using the printer to print some necessary upgrades like spool roller and filament guide wheel it worked great. Eventually setup octopi which made things more convenient. Large learning curve, but very fun and rewarding hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to putting this 3D printer together. Unfortunately, it came with some of the aluminum frame extrusions missing, so I never got a chance to start. Instead I had to spent the time trying to figure out how to get it all back into the box. If you do buy this printer, be sure to take inventory of all the parts before you start putting things together.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3d printer. I read several reviews and watched videos and this seemed to be the best bang for the buck. So far I'm very pleased! I've made 4 things and they turned out great! When putting it together i did have to bend a bracket a little bit to make it fit but all in all it was easy to assemble. Also the Z axis rod needed a little tweaking to make it line up Update. 2.8.19 i still love this printer. I even bought a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: A great first printer! I love it.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first 3d printer, and I'm really glad I chose the Ender 3. It's built to a budget so there are some upgrades I'd recommend once you've got it set up, but most of them are really a good learning opportunity for figuring out your new machine. There's a great community of fellow owners on Facebook and YouTube, so there are lots of resources to help you get started.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Inklings

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Quality 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great. My friends recommended it. Takes a little time to setup - give yourself 3 hours. Important to level and calibrate your nozzle to bed distance. Works great. Watch the YouTube setup if you've never put one together before - it will help you understand the picture instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Bounlay Bounleuth

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine for the money!
customer_reviews.text: After a 2hr assembly I was off on my first ever 3d print. I am very pleased with the performance of this machine. The assembly was not that hard. All the parts and bolts were easily labeled and nice instructions. I would recommend anyone interested in 3d printing to give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Go0oBaH

customer_reviews.title: Great quality 3d print
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3d printer, and so far it has not disappointed, the quality of the parts and the first couple of prints I was pleasantly surprised, it was the perfect father's day present. The only complain I have is that the included first filament is not enough to print something decent.
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Money!  For product and support
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing printer for the price. You build it yourself and be careful not to strip the screws but my 12 year old put it together and manages it although, he is fairly advanced. The Comgrow support staff are very customer friendly and resolve things immediately.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hagen

product_meta.title: Official Creality Ender 3 3D Printer Fully Open Source with Resume Printing Function 220x220x250mm
feature_bullets: Resume Print Function: Ender 3 has the ability to resume printing even after a power outage or lapse occurs.
Easy and Qucik Assembly: It comes with several assembled parts, you only need about 2 hours to assemble 20 nuts well.
Advanced Extruder Technology: Upgraded extruder greatly reduces plugging risk and bad extrustion; V-Shape with POM wheels make it move noiseless, smoothly and durable.
Safety Protected Power Supply: Only needs 5 minutes for hot bed to reach 110℃.
Strict Test: Strict testing for key components before delivery and life-time technical supports available.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
